results.title: In memory of Mawalan: a ceremony for Wandjuk's father
results.brief_description: In 1971 Wandjuk Marika organised a Djangkawu ceremony at Yirrkala in memory of his father, Mawalan who died in 1967. Mawalan had been the highly respected head of the Rirratjingu clan for whom the Djangkawu are primary creator ancestors. For this film Wandjuk has made explicit only outside or public interpretation of this ceremony. The ceremony was also important for its attempt to reinforce, for tribal members, the importance of their traditions. Contains some b&w footage.

results.title: In memory of Mark and Dusty
results.creator_credit: Denise Thompson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It is ten years since the tragic passing of Denise Thompson’s son Mark and the family dog Dusty. A loving tribute by a mother to her son and the pet dog he gave her when he was little.

results.title: In love cancer
results.creator_credit: Jenny Robertson and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: An experiment in which traditional narrative is displaced by visions of medication, dismemberment, desire, procreation, transfiguration and fatality. It endorses the imagination, the emotions and the irrational. Winner: Yoram Gross Animation Award, Sydney Film Festival 1987.

results.title: In Love and law (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Pip Karmel, Noel Price and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This video contains a series of three short episodes which examine issues that arise as a result of separation and divorce and offers advice on resolving conflict through counselling. Episode 1. “Calling it a day”, episode 2. “Baby makes three” and episode 3. “House and home”.

results.title: In Love (2001)
results.brief_description:
Much as Janine Antoni, Sally Mann, and Gillian Wearing have explored the sexuality and conflicts inherent to the parent-child relationship, Chang examines the territory of the primal, parental connection in her work In Love (2001). In this dual-channel video, two separate scenes of the artist with a parent are juxtaposed. Chang faces her mother and, in the adjacent frame, appears face–to–face with her father. Simultaneously both images show the artist’s and respective parent’s faces pressed together in what at first appears to be a deep kiss. Gradually it becomes evident that the video is running in reverse time, and that they share not a kiss but rather an onion from which they both eat. They bite into it slowly, pausing as they take turns offering it to each other, as if it suggests the proverbial, forbidden fruit. Parent and child swallow before they take additional bites, blinking hard to hold back tears from the onion’s sharpness and pungency. However, in the video’s reversal of time, the onion is reconstituted and the tears disappear—wholeness is thus regained. Held in the collection at the Guggenheim.

‘In this video, I share eating an onion with my mother and my father. The video is played backwards so that we begin in a kissing embrace with tears in our eyes. As the video plays, the tears roll back up and an onion emerges from our mouths. As the title suggests, the video is about the abstract boundaries of love, sacrifice, familial relations and inheritance.’ Patty Chang

constellations_other.description: This constellation explores media works that manipulate time, specifically by utitlising a reverse play structure to tell a story.

results.title: In limbo
results.creator_credit: Dai Le, Jessica Douglas-Henry, SBS Independent and Iris Pictures
results.brief_description: In limbo follows the story of an Australian -Vietnamese lawyer who is determined to see 2000 Vietnamese boat people stranded in the Philippines regain the lives, identities and homes. Hoi Trinh as been fighting for the rights of these people for more than five years. It’s a mammoth undertaking involving political lobbying and complex negotiations with immigration departments in Australia, the United States, Europe, Japan and the Philippines. This film sees Hoi battle the Australian Immigration Department bureaucracy as he tries to resettle 50 refugee familles in Australia. A moving and poignant documentary, this work provides an insight into the immigration debate through one man’s struggle.

results.title: In life's cycle
results.brief_description: A “temperance melodrama” about the effects of alcohol within a relationship when a young farm girl seeking to escape her drab life runs away with a city slicker who has a propensity for drinking and turning violent. Cast includes Stephanie Longfellow, Charles West, George Nichols, Linda Arvidson, Adele DeGarde. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: In heaven there is no beer
results.creator_credit: Les Blank, Maureen Gosling and Flower Films
results.brief_description: This film visits a number of intensive polka sessions (one of them an 11-day marathon) and observes the wildly enthusiastic participants. The film also examines the dancers’ Polish patriotism and their polka regalia, concluding that they may find a close and authentic sense of community through this form of folk art.

results.title: In good heart
results.creator_credit: Henry Cooper and Campbell Harper Films
results.brief_description: A description of the farming year in Scotland as seen in the lives of four farmers in the Border country, Ayrshire, the Highlands and Angus, and a reminder of the help received by farmers from various research institutes in their efforts to improve livestock and keep the land in the best possible condition.
